reviews.body:
### üí° Codex Review https://github.com/victorGPT/vibeusage/blob/af1f883886d8363feefddf65a080d0c9c233a27a/insforge-src/functions/vibescore-usage-model-breakdown.js#L243-L245 **![P2 Badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/P2-yellow?style=flat) Sort model breakdown by billable tokens** The model breakdown still orders models by `total_tokens` in `compareTotals`, but the UI now prefers `billable_total_tokens` for display. When cached input is present (e.g., Codex/Every Code), `billable_total_tokens` can be meaningfully lower than `total_tokens`, so the API ordering can rank models differently from what the user sees. Consider sorting by `billable_total_tokens` (with a fallback to `total_tokens`) so the list order matches the new billable totals.

comments.author: victorGPT
comments.body: Addressed Codex review items: 1) Aggregate models before enqueueing hourly buckets: enqueue now groups by source+hour across all model buckets and emits a single record (keeps model only when a single model is present, otherwise defaults to unknown). This avoids source+hour overwrite under the current ingest dedupe. Added test: parseRolloutIncremental aggregates multiple models within the same hour. 2) Migrate v1 hourly buckets: normalizeHourlyState now migrates v1 buckets into v2 with model=unknown instead of resetting, preserving prior totals. Added test: parseRolloutIncremental migrates v1 hourly buckets without resetting totals. Tests re-run: node --test test/rollout-parser.test.js test/init-uninstall.test.js test/uploader.test.js

comments.author: victorGPT
comments.body: Addressed Codex feedback: Claude normalization now honors total_tokens when present and only falls back to input+output if missing. Added test: parseClaudeIncremental honors total_tokens when present. Tests re-run: node --test test/rollout-parser.test.js test/init-uninstall.test.js test/uploader.test.js

comments.author: victorGPT
comments.body: Addressed Codex P1: uploader now dedupes within each batch by source+hour (ignores model in the dedupe key), so when model diversity changes mid-hour we only upload the latest row for that hour. Added test: drainQueueToCloud dedupes by source and hour when model changes. Tests re-run: node --test test/rollout-parser.test.js test/init-uninstall.test.js test/uploader.test.js

reviews.author: chatgpt-codex-connector
reviews.body:
### üí° Codex Review https://github.com/victorGPT/vibeusage/blob/af1f883886d8363feefddf65a080d0c9c233a27a/insforge-src/functions/vibescore-usage-model-breakdown.js#L243-L245 **![P2 Badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/P2-yellow?style=flat) Sort model breakdown by billable tokens** The model breakdown still orders models by `total_tokens` in `compareTotals`, but the UI now prefers `billable_total_tokens` for display. When cached input is present (e.g., Codex/Every Code), `billable_total_tokens` can be meaningfully lower than `total_tokens`, so the API ordering can rank models differently from what the user sees. Consider sorting by `billable_total_tokens` (with a fallback to `total_tokens`) so the list order matches the new billable totals.
